result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas Peter Aguirre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lucas Peter Aguirre is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lucas Peter Aguirre was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
Apply bond on file and refund balance to payor.
DNA surcharge.
Defendant to submit a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lucas Peter Aguirre

defendant.name: Aguirre, Lucas Peter
defendant.address: 660 Circle Pine Drive #101, New Richmond, WI 54017

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Lucas Aguirre ck# 026059 sent this date. eif

CO: RMW, REP: Kasten, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Megan E. Kelly  . Lucas Peter Aguirre pro se. Case called at 4:05 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a plea and sentencing hearing. ADA Kelly recites recommendations. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct 2 Disorderly Conduct without domestic abuse enhancer in 16CM49. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reviews the right to obtain an attorney with DE. DE understands and wishes to continue without representation.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 2 Disorderly Conduct without domestic abuse enhancer in 16CM49. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 16CM49. DE makes statement. 20 days to file appeal. 

Crt orders:

- Court costs of $243.00

- DNA Sample and DNA Surcharge of $200.00. Bond to apply. Any refund to be returned to payor.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 6, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Megan E. Kelly. Lucas Peter Aguirre pro se. Case called at 10:34 a.m. ADA Kelly requesting a plea hearing be set. DE needs to complete a domestic abuse assessment. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 4, 2016 at 10:30 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Megan E. Kelly. Lucas Peter Aguirre pro se appears via phone. Case called at 4:39 p.m. Court notes this is set for a pre trial conference. DE states vehicle broke down. ADA Kelly prepared a pro se offer. Will send by mail. Set for another pre trial conference. DE does not want to hire attorney. Court directs DE he needs to be present in person.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Lucas Peter Aguirre
Current: 660 Circle Pine Drive #101, New Richmond, WI 54017   (Effective: 04-20-2016)
Prior: 660 Circle Pine Drive, New Richmond, WI 54017

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Megan E. Kelly. Lucas Peter Aguirre pro se. Case called at 4:20 p.m. Court notes this is the date and time set for a PTC. Court reviews the rights with the DE to obtain an attorney. DE will contact the public defender's office and is also given an application for court appointed attorney.  Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Bond on file.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Charish A.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO:  TCH for RMW, (Recorder), Clerk: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Megan E. Kelly, Lucas Peter Aguirre pro se. Defendant does not qualify for PD. Court confirms address. Court questions Defendant.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Court enters NG.  Reserves speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 04:15 pm.
